content:
As already said here, test & validator 4 have A=0 even though in constraints it is said that 0 < A.

Could you fix the tests please?

Just run this in a clash and all except me, quit before 2 min mark.
I think this clash needs more examples of what you are looking for.
Like this:

4 is not valid because factors are 2,2
5 is not valid because factors are just 5
6 is valid because factors are 2,3
8  is not valid because factors are 2,2,2
10 is valid because factors are 2,5

So a range from 1 to 9, the answer is 1 because 6 is the only valid number.
This contribution hasnâ€™t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

Edited to improve the formatting, the constraints and fix the stub.
Maybe tests should also have an explicit name.

EDIT: The constraints indicate A>0 (even before my modifications) but the T/V 4 use A=0. Because the notion of "prime factor of 0" is not properly defined (similar problem with 1 by the way), I would recommend to start at 1 (or even 2).

The stub is looking for n*n numbers instead of n*2 numbers.

You need to state a constraint on N. 
In fact, I would include tests with much larger N (and maybe larger a, b) such that an inefficient algorithm would time out.
This was inspired by a recent puzzle on FiveThirtyEight: https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/can-you-decode-the-riddler-lottery/
According to the author's solution, an inefficient approach is the intended solution. But that's not at all an issue for a CoC.
